Your very own Plex Media Server in the c: Your very own Plex Media Server in the cloud. No computer required.
Thanks for participating in the Plex Clo: Thanks for participating in the Plex Cloud beta! There are just a few quick steps between here and your very own Plex Media Server in the sky.
First, we’ll link your cloud storage to: First, we’ll link your cloud storage to your Plex account. Choose from popular providers like Dropbox and Google Drive.
Next, we’ll create your Plex Cloud. This: Next, we’ll create your Plex Cloud. This may take a minute or two.
Finally, add your media to your cloud st: Finally, add your media to your cloud storage and scan it in! Plex Cloud works just like a regular Media Server. Choose it from the location menu in your favorite Plex app and stream away!
Find more Plex Cloud settings or add add: Find more Plex Cloud settings or add additional storage providers
Congratulations! You qualify for a free: Congratulations! You qualify for a free year of Plex Pass Lite!
Enjoy your media offline on Android, iOS: Enjoy your media offline on Android, iOS, and Windows devices
Sync photos from your mobile devices to: Sync photos from your mobile devices to Plex Media Server
Sync media to the cloud and enjoy it any: Sync media to the cloud and enjoy it anywhere there’s internet

or give Plex Pass as a gift!: or give Plex Pass as a gift!

Importing from iTunes will import your m: Importing from iTunes will import your music playlists. It will also import your ratings, the date you added the music, as well as play and skip counts for tracks in your library. Depending on how many tracks you have, this process can take many minutes to complete.

If you skip this step you will not be ab: If you skip this step you will not be able to share or stream media outside your home. If you change your mind later, you can adjust this in Settings.
If you would like to enable this now, yo: If you would like to enable this now, you will need to configure your router or firewall to allow Plex to contact your server. Please refer to our {1}Connecting a Server{2} article for more information.

Prefer the HTML5 video player over the F: Prefer the HTML5 video player over the Flash player.
Allows the player to play compatible med: Allows the player to play compatible media without any conversion.
Allows the player to play compatible media without any conversion. In most browsers, direct play supports MP4 videos with h264 video and AAC audio. Videos with subtitles cannot be played directly.
Allows the server to copy compatible aud: Allows the server to copy compatible audio and video streams without converting them.
Allow Direct Play of AC3 Audio: Allow Direct Play of AC3 Audio
Allow MP4 videos with AC3 audio to be pl: Allow MP4 videos with AC3 audio to be played directly. Browser support for AC3 audio is limited.
Prefer AAC over MP3 when transcoding aud: Prefer AAC over MP3 when transcoding audio. Some devices, like the Wii U, only support HLS with AAC audio.
Boost volume when converting multi-chann: Boost volume when converting multi-channel audio to stereo.
Determines if the server should burn in: Determines if the server should burn in subtitles when converting video depending on the subtitles format. Avoiding burn in improves server performance and is only supported by the HTML5 player.

A large number of sync items may be time-consuming to convert and transfer to your device. If you have trouble, try reducing the number of items.

Adding a Plex user to your home will all: Adding a Plex user to your home will allow you to quickly switch accounts. The invited user will be asked to confirm home membership.
Managed users are only available when si: Managed users are only available when signed in with an account in your home. You can choose any name you like and you'll be able to set restrictions on accessible media.

{1}, so we've made a few changes to help: {1}, so we've made a few changes to help keep your media safe.
We've increased the security requirement: We've increased the security requirements on this server, so anything communicating with it will need to be signed in to a Plex account.
We've disabled DLNA to prevent any DLNA-: We've disabled DLNA to prevent any DLNA-enabled device from browsing and playing media without a password or PIN. You can change this preference in your {1}server settings{2}.
